equipment.name: Frying Pan
descriptions: Functions as both a bludgeoning weapon and a small shield. What's not to like?
It's not much less effective than a small mace, honestly.
It'll make a nice, satisfying CLANG that you just won't get from a flanged mace.
flavor: "I have seen greater men than you brought low by a woman with a frying pan." -- Solo

equipment.name: Masterwork Cutting Board
descriptions: Guaranteed not to scratch, or your money back.
It's just a block of wood, but then again, so is a shield.
These are designed to stop knives, so why not swords?
flavor: "It is a dark day that forces me to bear a humble cutting board for defence." -- Talrath

equipment.name: Chopsticks
descriptions: It's like a pair of wooden daggers. You could probably poke someone's eye out.
Technically, dual-wielding bonuses can apply to these.
Is that red stain blood, or just sweet and sour sauce...?
flavor: "They are better than nothing, and I mean that in the most unflattering way possible." -- Aria

equipment.name: Cheap Replica Sword
descriptions: This is it! The legendary sword! ...wait, what's this "Made in Chongsheng" sticker on the handle?
This is it! The legendary sword! ...No, this can't be it... Too bad.
Don't worry, we'll get you a real sword later.
flavor: "Think this is funny? Let's see how hard you laugh after I shove this down your throat." -- Hodge

equipment.name: A Stick
descriptions: It's a wand, if you pretend hard enough.
An enterprising merchant might pass this off as an all-natural, organic wand.
With the power of imagination, you can transform it into a wand!
flavor: "The sad thing is, this isn't the lowest-quality wand I've ever had to use." -- Marty

equipment.name: Fuzzy Robes
descriptions: Isn't this some great mage's bathrobe?
These fine robes offer protection from ambient humidity... okay, it's a bathrobe.
Fortunately, the mage whose bathrobe this is thought to enchant it a tiny bit, just in case.
flavor: "I suppose I shall now be prepared if we happen to bump into a steam golem." -- Avaris

equipment.name: The Big Book of Cantrips
descriptions: Its only practical use is to remind you that you have real spells you can use.
A collection of magical party tricks for aspiring casters or those with their sights set low.
Maybe one of these harmless spells will at least distract the monsters for a moment.
flavor: "I remember this book. I last read it when I was five." -- Laurie

equipment.name: Ring of Arcane Might
descriptions: Enhances the spells you cast as long as you only use the ring finger to do it.
This small and unimpressive ring grants a small and unimpressive boost to magic.
This ring sits on your finger and only amplifies the power of spells that pass through it.
flavor: "For a moment there, I was worried we'd found something useful." -- Dresbin

equipment.name: Macaroni Holy Symbol
descriptions: Some priest's kid probably made this.
The product of sunday school, no doubt.
flavor: "I was not aware my fellow men of the cloth were being equipped by children." -- Neville

equipment.name: Ceremonial Robes
descriptions: Completely unsuitable for use in a dungeon, but sometimes you have to take what you can get.
They provide absolutely no protection but at least they make you look clerical.
White silk with gold threading certainly looks fancy but doesn't stop monsters whacking you.
flavor: "These robes are dry clean only. Wearing them in this dungeon will ruin them." -- Siebel

equipment.name: Incorrect Holy Symbol
descriptions: It's a holy symbol for SOMEONE'S deity, and that's close enough for now.
This belongs to some religion so obscure even its followers don't remember it.
Maybe if you glue a couple more bits of wood to it, it'll look just like one of yours.
flavor: "I think the followers of Kra'fina were peaceful farmers. Or tyrants. History is fuzzy on the details." -- Mulcahy

equipment.name: Holy Page
descriptions: The rest of the Holy Book is missing, but the verse on this page is a poignant one.
Maybe the rest of book is around here somewhere.
It would be nicer to have the whole book, but Page 77 will have to do.
flavor: "It appears to cut off before the last word, but I'll take a guess that it's 'Amen'." -- Erdan

equipment.name: Empty Flour Sack
descriptions: A hood would be better, but anything that covers your face will suffice.
Hopefully you don't have a gluten allergy.
Try not to let the leftover particles of flour make you sneeze.
flavor: "Here, let's put 'dis over Tal'akh's face so we don't have to look at him." -- Wyatt

equipment.name: Carpet Squares
descriptions: Tie them to your boots to muffle your footsteps. In theory, anyway.
Wear them on your feet and it's almost as if the whole dungeon is carpeted.
If the dungeon has no carpet, then bring the carpet to it.
flavor: "This would be a better plan if the carpet wasn't lime green. Not much better. But better." -- Aria

equipment.name: Black Flag
descriptions: Wear it as a cloak. Perfect for anti-heroes; it's as dark as your past is.
This perfectly black flag is the banner of the Darkest Elven Queendoms.
The flag is from an underground nation with no light. But why would they need a flag at all?
flavor: "I would appreciate it if sssomone could cut a head hole into thisss thing..." -- Mardak

equipment.name: Padded Gloves
descriptions: For when you need to walk on your hands, of course.
Protects you from grazing your hands on the rough dungeon walls.
Guaranteed to prevent papercuts or your money back.
flavor: "Hang on, these are just oven mitts!" -- Talon

equipment.name: Double Clawed Hammer
descriptions: You can still drive nails with it if you turn it sideways, I guess.
Maybe you're meant to dual-wield it with a double-headed hammer?
Someone obviously doesn't understand the purpose of hammers.
flavor: "I'm not sure this is an upgrade from the chunk o' rock I was using before." -- Davey

equipment.name: Tri-Headed Screwdriver
descriptions: Only the elves use these kinds of screws, but it might be handy...?
These screws are used by craftsmen who want to prevent people from repairing their things.
Only the most determined collector would even bother owning one of these.
flavor: "Has anyone here ever seen a screw that this would be compatible with?" -- Volkur

equipment.name: Unserrated Pliers
descriptions: They could still turn bolts well enough in a pinch.
You'll need an iron grip for these to do anything useful.
These must have come from the most useless toolbox ever.
flavor: "I know it is said a poor workman blames his tools, but in this instance, I feel justified." -- Avaris

equipment.name: Circular Spirit Level
descriptions: Maybe it's more useful in another plane of existence.
Obviously this is used when performing n-dimensional construction.
Still kind of works, since it'll roll off of anything not level that you set it on...
flavor: "I would hate to see the house built using one of these things." -- Narius

consumables.name: Liquid Courage
descriptions: A shot of this stuff will carry you into battle! Too bad there's only one shot.
Alcohol is a perfect substitute for bravery, if you have enough of it.
Don't confuse the lightheadedness of the booze with battle fury.
flavor: "How convenient. I was just thinking that this dungeon is driving me to drink." -- Kirak

consumables.name: Potion of Gain Advantage
descriptions: Isn't this for a mechanic from the next edition?
This is a potion from the future! Actually, I don't think this exists in the next edition either.
Someone thoughtfully backported a mechanic from the next edition.
flavor: "Is this really the best the future has to offer?" -- Uharo

consumables.name: Grade A Steak
descriptions: Loaded with enough protein to guarantee musculature.
The dinner (and breakfast and lunch) of muscleman adventurers everywhere.
Hopefully this didn't come from a beast with poisonous or acidic flesh.
flavor: "This more like it! Vikari tired of trail mix.." -- Vikari

consumables.name: Scroll of Icy Glare
descriptions: Harnesses a power previously wielded only by housewives and drill sergeants.
Stop them cold in their tracks with the power of disapproval!
The sheer weight of your glare will critically stun family members and subordinates especially.
flavor: "This scroll is only a fraction as powerful as a master of the art... thankfully." -- Solo

consumables.name: Spoiled Potion
descriptions: The best before date is from ten years ago. Drinking is unadvised; try throwing it instead.
'Store in a cool, dry place' the label says, but this dungeon is humid and musty.
This potion has a layer of scum on the top and floating black bits... you're better off throwing it.
flavor: "I think I've found less disgusting substances stuck in the sinks at the warmage college." -- Laurie

consumables.name: Potion of Magic Energy
descriptions: How does a glass bottle hold a miniature tempest of arcane energy? Don't ask.
Are you supposed to drink it or throw it? Better nominate someone disposable to test it.
Casters turn spells into magic energy. This is full of magic energy. Seems straightforward enough.
flavor: "It might vaporize what we throw it at, or it might collapse the entire dungeon. Let's find out." -- Eleri

consumables.name: Holy(-ish) Water
descriptions: All the real priests were busy that day, so the initiate got to make the water.
A lack of quality control has resulted in an unordained cleric making holy water to mediocre effect.
The Clerics of Bavora outsourced their holy water production to nations with cheap labor, and this is the result.
flavor: "Perhaps I should keep this for when I give You Get What You Pay For sermons." -- Neville

consumables.name: Scroll of Hymn
descriptions: Someone accidentally wrote a song sheet using magical scribing tools, so it turns to dust once sung.
Though a powerful verse, it's hard to remember the specifics, and the scroll annoyingly crumbles after use.
This flagrant abuse of spell parchment and magic ink should at least be used to what little effect it creates.
flavor: "If anyone in my order wasted valuable materials in this fashion, I'd turn their skin into parchment to replace it." -- The Formless

consumables.name: Communion Whiskey
descriptions: Some churches aren't very picky about the alcohol they use.
This probably was intended for a dwarven communion ceremony.
Communion Whiskey ensures that a priest's followers have a strong alcohol tolerance.
flavor: "Is this why none of my acolytes ever want to hold morning services?" -- Erdan

consumables.name: Nerfed Potion of Invisibility
descriptions: Lasts for two rounds? Wow, it's almost useless now.
It used to be these potions lasted five minutes, now it's about ten seconds.
Older adventurers tell tales over tankards of ale about how these used to actually be useful.
flavor: "I used to have a bag full of these, too, before they went and cast the Ritual of Rebalancing..." -- Tal'akh

consumables.name: Scroll of Quiet, Please
descriptions: It's not quite as good as Silence but it's good enough when you just need some peace.
These are most commonly found in libraries that can't afford Scrolls of Silence.
Schools, libraries, daycares and courthouses burn through hundreds of these every day.
flavor: "This would be much more useful if I didn't have to read it out loud." -- Tavila

consumables.name: Bag of Sand
descriptions: Scatter it in front of you. It's marginally quieter than walking on the bare floor.
The soft crunch of underfoot sand is quieter than the echoing noise tiles make, so...
Throw sand onto rough ground, step on sand to be quieter. Flour would probably be a better choice.
flavor: "I hope I have enough sand left to whack whoever I sneak up on." -- Mac

consumables.name: Scroll of Create Magical Toolset
descriptions: Unfortunately it shows up under three layers of packaging and disappears after two minutes.
Disappears after a short while, a matter complicated by the many layers of packaging.
Perfectly serviceable, if you can get it out of the packaging before its duration expires.
flavor: "Whoever made this thing is an insufferable tease." -- Narius

consumables.name: Potion of Open Lock
descriptions: Wasn't this skill removed two editions ago?
Is Open Lock even still a thing? Will this boost Disable Device instead?
Still good enough to drink despite being two editions old, but not good enough to be terribly helpful.
flavor: "Careful there, the last person who drank one of these started ranting about 'THACO's." -- Karth

consumables.name: Demonstration Wand of Detect Traps
descriptions: Trial version. Contains 1 casting of Detect Traps. To order the full version, contact your local arcane supplier.
Hi there! This wand was made by a local artificer. Please support me by ordering the full version of this wand.
If you enjoyed this wand, please consider buying a full one to send some gold pieces my way. Thanks!
flavor: "An interesting business idea, but the Magic Mouth reminder every five minutes is terrible customer service." -- Uharo

consumables.name: Watered-Down Healing Potion
descriptions: Is there even any potion left in this thing or is it just water?
It's so diluted you can practically see through the phial it's in.
flavor: "I don't this will cure particularly much other than thirst." -- Eleri

consumables.name: Potion of Painkillers
descriptions: Now, to find some real first aid...
It'll hold you for a while, but it's only treating the symptoms.
Temporary health still counts as health, right?
flavor: "I take these now and again to deal with migraines, not stab wounds." -- Marty

consumables.name: Shotglass of Medicine
descriptions: This wound be great if there was more of it.
It'd be better if you had the bottle this was poured from.
Potent, sure, but where's the rest of it?
flavor: "Am I expected to toassst before I drink thisss?" -- Mardak

consumables.name: Crushed Herbal Remedy
descriptions: These are SUPPOSED to be eaten whole. Oh well, they still work... a bit.
Made from delicate herbs, crushing them has all but ruined them.
Is this what a failed Herbalism check looks like?
flavor: "Not all herbal medicine involves a mortar and pestle!" -- Asira

consumables.name: Scroll of Cure Wound
descriptions: A printing error makes what should be a Scroll of Cure Wounds less useful.
Someone forgot the last 's' on the name and now it's not quite so helpful.
A practical reminder to double-check your spelling when scribing scrolls.
flavor: "I thought people had to be literate to scribe scrolls." -- Ralford

boss.name: The Air Elemental
descriptions: A swirling, vaguely humanoid shape guarding the portal to the Plane of Air. It'll be a breeze compared to later opponents.
A man-shaped collection of gaseous vapors, guarding the Air Portal. Don't get blown away by its strength.
Swirling vapors and gases have gathered to take the shape of a person. It's the weakest elemental, but don't let overconfidence cloud your focus.
flavor: "If you think an air elemental is harmless, just wait until one blows you off a cliff." -- Mac

texts: Burn away the gases with fire!
Freeze it with a cone of cold!
Smother it with a cloud of acid!
Ward the party against its power!
Banish it back to the elemental planes!
Find a weak point and stab it!
Stand firmly so it can't push you, then strike!

events.name: Arrow Trap
descriptions: One of the classics. No dungeon would be complete without one.
Concealed hole in wall fires arrow when triggered. A timeless classic.
You don't have a REAL dungeon until you've installed some of these.
flavor: "Just once I'd like to see a crossbow trap or even a throwing axe trap, just for variety." -- Talon

texts: Knock the arrow out of the air.

events.name: Quarterstaff Trap
descriptions: It used to be a spear trap, but the spearhead broke off long ago.
Lack of maintenance has turned what used to be a spear trap into this.
The spearhead broke off some time ago, leaving just the shaft of wood.
flavor: "This kind of shoddy upkeep would never happen under MY watch!" -- Erdan

events.name: Pit Trap
descriptions: A staple of low-cost traps everywhere, the humble pit trap requires only a shovel and poor lighting to set up.
Needing just a shovel and bad lighting, a pit trap is an excellent choice for an architect on a budget.
Most of the material of a pit trap is elbow grease; even goblins have creation of this trap figured out.
flavor: "AAAAAH-! Oof! ...hey, I found a pit trap!" -- Narius

texts: Fall down, then climb back up.
Jump if you can, get thrown across if you can't.
Strong folks, carry the noodly folks when you jump over.

events.name: Rune of Wound
descriptions: Whoever inscribed this rune wasn't terribly imaginative, but it get the job done.
Does this get canceled out by the Scroll of Cure Wound?
A simple rune made by a simple mind, but it still does what it promises.
flavor: "It could be worse. It could have had an adjective, like grisly wound or festering wound." -- Eleri

events.name: Rune of... something.
descriptions: Trying to figure out what this scrawled rune is supposed to be makes your brain hurt!
What IS this rune? The longer I stare at it the more of a headache you get!
It's like one of those magic eye puzzles but inscribed onto the surface of a doorway.
flavor: "Okay, I've narrowed it down to only 4,672 remaining possibilities... I think." -- Marty

texts: Minor ward from everything, just in case.
What's the worst that can happen?
Ow, so that's what it does.

events.name: Rune of Itching
descriptions: No matter how much you scratch, the itch just doesn't go away!
It feels like someone's rubbing burlap and denim against your skin!
You feel like you have sand in all of your crevices, even ones you didn't know existed!
flavor: "Stop whining! Some of us are wearing plate mail, try scratching yourself through that!" -- Talrath

texts: Undo the rune, if you can focus long enough...
If you can't stop scratching then don't stop running!

events.name: Demonic Crystal
descriptions: It's playing some kind of demonic chant backwards, and it hurts your ears to listen.
Whatever noise this crystal is making, you can't hear it, but you can FEEL it on your eardrums.
This crystal is making a noise that sounds like a cross between nail-on-chalkboard and fifty crying babies.
flavor: "It's still not as bad as the 'music' those inner-city bards are making." -- Bradley

texts: Clean the blood from your ears and keep moving.
Ward the party against the crystal's effects.

events.name: Blood Rune of Advertisements
descriptions: Covers your vision and blots out your hearing with demonic pop-ups, causing you to blunder into other traps.
This rune obscures your vision with pop-up ads for pre-approved soul sales, making you stumble into more traps.
No matter how fast you dismiss the pop-ups, more still come, leaving you defenceless to other traps.
flavor: "No! I don't want any! Get outta here! Any of you clerics got a spell for 'dis?" -- Wyatt

texts: Get out of range, no matter the cost.
Just stumble forward until you get out of range.
Cast the Lesser Ad Blocker spell.

events.name: Floor Zombie
descriptions: This is why you're not supposed to walk on the cracks between floor tiles.
Some zombie fell into a trap door pit, and now takes swipes at passersby.
This trap door has been made more hazardous by the unintentional addition of a zombie.
flavor: "Makes me glad I wore my knee-length hunting boots today." -- Ralford

texts: Rebuke the zombie so it leaves you alone.
Turn Undead so it won't be a problem.

events.name: Stone Block Trap
descriptions: These things are the real reason people wear spiked helmets.
A less than friendly reminder to wear a helmet when dungeoneering.
Given the state of the dungeon, it may just be a collapsing section of the ceiling.
flavor: "Careful... don't step over there unless you have a burning desire to be flatter." -- Lyndra

texts: I've taken worse wounds in tavern brawls.

events.name: Low Budget Caltrops
descriptions: Four-sided dice have been scattered on the floor, and are surprisingly painful to step on.
Plastic building blocks from a children's toy set are scattered here, and hurt to step on.
Numerous glass shards are covering the ground here. Mind your feet!
flavor: "Did anyone happen to see a broom earlier in the dungeon?" -- Tal'akh

texts: Find a path through the caltrops.
Scout a way through the caltrops.

events.name: Tripwire Hallway
descriptions: The tripwires aren't connected to anything, but that doesn't make the tripping any more pleasant.
Landing on your face is pretty embarrassing, so watch your step.
Careful, the floor here is rough concrete just to make your fall all the worse.
flavor: "Wha- ow! ...careful, I found a trip wire." -- Narius

texts: Locate and mark all the tripwires.
Just walk forward, it can't be that bad.
A little trip never hurt anyone.

events.name: Obvious Pressure Plate
descriptions: It wouldn't be that threatening if it didn't take up the entire corridor.
It's easy to see, but unfortunately it takes up the whole floor.
The fact that you can easily spot it doesn't help, given that it takes up the entire floor.
flavor: "Maybe this was cheaper than tiling the whole corridor?" -- Marty

texts: Whatever it does can't be -that- bad.

events.name: Rusted Axe Trap
descriptions: Could really use some oil; it doesn't swing as fast as it used to.
This thing hasn't been oiled in a long time, which is probably to your benefit.
The rust makes the trap swing slower, but it also might cause tetanus.
flavor: "Now see, this is exactly why high quality traps use mithril on the joints." -- Davey

events.name: Swinging Steak Knife
descriptions: Whoever set this trap must have been low on parts and in a hurry.
Some dungeon architects build traps from scrap and junk to keep costs down.
A+ for creative use of parts, D- for effectiveness.
flavor: "What next, a swinging shiv trap?" -- Tal'akh

events.name: Jammed Door
descriptions: Why don't dungeon builders account for humidity when installing wooden doors?
The humidity of the dungeon has caused this door to refuse to open.
Humidity and wooden doors do not mix very well, especially in ancient dungeons.
flavor: "Stand aside. Vikari have something to unstick door: Vikari's foot." -- Vikari

events.name: Rusted Lever
descriptions: A fine lesson on why not to use untreated iron when constructing your dungeon.
Humid dungeons and ungalvanized metal are a disaster waiting to happen.
It's got so much rust on it, there may not even be any iron left.
flavor: "This is worse than that Rust Monster infestation I cleared back in '47." -- Ralford

events.name: Cave-in
descriptions: Some previous overzealous adventurer knocked down a load-bearing column.
At least this didn't happen while you were in the room.
An example of why you should be careful swinging a greathammer near support pillars.
flavor: "Don't look at me, Disintegrate will only remove one rock at a time." -- Eleri

texts: Shove the rubble out of the way.

events.name: Rune of Shiny
descriptions: You can't help but stare at it for minutes on end...
It's so pretty! You just want to stop and look at it for a while.
A shiny thing, the guaranteed bait for adventurers of all kinds.
flavor: "So shiny... must steal... can we pull that brick out of the wall...?" -- Kirak

texts: Stare at it for a while.
So shiny! Admire it for a bit.

events.name: Arcane Puzzle Lock
descriptions: It's pretty straightforward, but the instructions are in an ancient language.
Not a difficult puzzle but the instructions are written in runes for some reason.
This puzzle would be easier if the directions weren't written with magical runes.
flavor: "It might say 'push' or it might say 'pull'. My Ancient Dalvarian is a bit rusty." -- Tavila

events.name: Blinking Rune
descriptions: That rune is blinking! It's so distracting; find a way to make it stop!
Simple things amuse simple... hey! That rune is blinking!
Not only is this rune blinking, it's making an annoying buzzing sound.
flavor: "Why did I agree to come in here with such easily distracted fools, again?" -- Siebel

texts: Find a way to make it stop!

events.name: Break Room
descriptions: Even seasoned adventurers find it hard to resist the smell of a fresh pot of coffee.
Fortunately, no monsters are in here, so you have it all to yourself. Coffee break time!
A cup of coffee and a few pastries will ensure the success of this adventure.
flavor: "We'd better get in 'dere quick before Vikari eats all the food." -- Wyatt

texts: A little break won't hurt, right?

events.name: Insurance Salesimp
descriptions: That's a nice wagon you have outside... it'd be a real shame if something happened to it.
Adventurers like you really ought to take the time to sign a life insurance policy.
You wouldn't want to be inconvenienced if your wagon outside were to burst into flame, would you?
flavor: "Damn fiend! Take your protection rackets back to hell, and put me on the Do-Not-Contract list!" -- Neville

texts: Tell it no until it goes away.

events.name: Nairkholexaqliag'nallfh'picus
descriptions: This minor demon's only notable feature is that it blocks your way until someone pronounces its name correctly.
This unpronounceable demon's sinister plot involves a force field that can only be dispelled by speaking its name.
To get past this annoying demon, you 'just' have to speak its name without any mispronunciations.
flavor: "Oh, sure, let me just DISLOCATE MY TONGUE so I can get this thing out of the way." -- Hodge

texts: Narco... nairko.. nearkho... this will take a while.

events.name: Miniature Labyrinth
descriptions: The architect was going to make it a lot bigger, but they went over-budget.
It would have been more elaborate if the architect had had more time.
Fortunately for you, the builder ran out of money and cut it down in size.
flavor: "I'm fairly sure I could find my way through this blindfolded." -- Ralford

events.name: Pressure Plate Maze
descriptions: The plates aren't wired to anything, but they sound like nails on a chalkboard so you need to avoid them anyway.
Stepping on one does nothing except make a scraping noise that hurts your ears.
You need to avoid the plates, not for traps, but because they make an agonizing nails-on-chalkboard sound.
flavor: "You think you have it bad? Some of us have keen elven senses." -- Aria

texts: Find a way around the plates.
Find a path through the plates.
Determine what tiles are plates and avoid them.

events.name: Glue Sprayer Trap
descriptions: Typical, you just washed your equipment earlier today, too.
Ugh, and you washed all your gear earlier...
Great, now you're stuck to the floor AND it's oozing under your armor.
flavor: "'Don't prepare Prestidigitation,' you guys told me. 'It's all monsters and traps,' you said..." -- Marty

texts: Scrape off the glue and keep going.
Tear yourself free of the glue.

events.name: Obvious Secret Door
descriptions: There's ALWAYS a secret door in a dead-end like this, it's just a matter of finding it.
A dead-end corridor? There MUST be a secret door here!
No dungeon can have a corridor ending in nothing. There's obviously a secret door.
flavor: "Trust me, pal, dungeon construction regulations require secret doors in all dead-ends." -- Rick

texts: Poke every brick and pull every torch.
Press every brick in the wall until you find the right one.

events.name: Gear Puzzle
descriptions: Pile of gears on the floor. Exposed incomplete machinery in a wall access panel. What comes next is obvious.
An open panel to some machinery is next to a bunch of gears on the floor. Seems obvious what to do next.
A bunch of gears have been removed from a door control mechanism. Better put them back in and hope none are missing.
flavor: "Child's play. Quite literally. I believe I have seen toys based on this premise." -- Avaris

texts: Try gears at random until it works.
Shove gears in until it works.

events.name: Trapped Locked Door
descriptions: Unfortunately, if you kick this one, it explodes; best to just pick the lock.
Breaking down the door makes it explode, so picking the lock is recommended.
Someone expected you to kick the door open instead of lockpicking it; it'll explode if you try that.
flavor: "Step back, meatheads, this one is going to require some finesse, not smashy-smashy." -- Kirak

texts: Disarm the trap and open the door.

monsters.name: Sizzling Lizard
descriptions: This lizard glows bright red because it's hot enough to melt iron, so don't attack it with anything you're particularly attached to.
A type of salamander hot enough to melt iron. Ranged attacks are recommended.
Unlike other lizards, this one generates its own heat, so much so that it sets things on fire by touching them.
flavor: "I strongly recommend our unarmed fighters leave this one to the archers." -- Ralford

texts: Some ice spells will sort this out.
Blast it with a wave of frost.

monsters.name: Unconvincing Mimic
descriptions: The shading on it is too bright compared to its surroundings.
It's using the wrong color palette for this section of the dungeon.
It's not aligned on the same five-foot boundary all other dungeon objects are.
flavor: "There's something wrong about this chest... okay, everything is wrong about this chest." -- Asira

texts: Give it a whack before it strikes.

monsters.name: Minor Demon
descriptions: This demon is so low on the infernal ladder that it doesn't even have a name or description.
It's so minor that it doesn't have a name or any sort of description.
A demon so boring nobody has bothered to name or describe it.
flavor: "I have no idea what it is - I only study IMPORTANT demons." -- Mulcahy

texts: Hardly worth it, but banish it anyway.

monsters.name: Crazed Dwarf
descriptions: "Come, fight me!" he shouts, "Losing is fun!"
This dwarven warrior charges you on sight with a cry of "Losing is fun!"
A dwarf driven mad by the dungeon, he has taken the battle cry of "Losing is fun!"
flavor: "I once heard of an entire fortress of my kin falling victim to a madness much like this." -- Volkur

texts: Beat the rocks out of him.

monsters.name: Goblin Scavenger
descriptions: An economically and ecologically friendly goblin, she recycles the equipment of dead adventurers by selling it off to new ones.
This goblin does her part for the environment by recycling the equipment of dead adventurers, selling it to new ones.
Adventurers on a budget can buy secondhand equipment from goblins like these who loot the bodies of other adventurers.
flavor: "I don't want a dead guy's gear. It obviously didn't do him any good." -- Hodge

texts: Knock her out while she's distracted by something shiny.
Beat her up and take her stuff.

monsters.name: Rebellious Elven Youth
descriptions: "I'm 107, why don't my parents listen to me? I should be allowed to dye my hair and wear eye shadow..."
You can overhear complaints about his parents' curfew and bedtime rules despite him being 107 years old.
From what you overhear, this 107-year-old ran into this dungeon because his parents didn't approve of his girlfriend.
flavor: "I bet he'sss ssstill living in his parentsss' houssse, too." -- Mardak

monsters.name: Swarm of Cats
descriptions: This dungeon used to have swarms of rats, but then this happened.
Once, there were swarms of rats in this area. Now, there's this.
This is why you'll never encounter any rats in this dungeon.

texts: Set a trap and lure them into it.
This is what sweep attacks are for.

monsters.name: Kobold Trapper
descriptions: It's actually a friendly monster, but spike traps and swinging blades are traditional kobold greetings.
Spike traps! Swinging blades! They'd be more threatening if they weren't small-sized.
The gauntlet of spike traps and swinging blades were this monster's welcome mat.
flavor: "Oh, no, the traps are solely for when other races come to our homes. We don't like visitors." -- Kirak

monsters.name: Alchemical Mishap
descriptions: It's hard to tell what's worse; this thing, or that the dungeon floor is withstanding its caustic substances.
The dungeon floor is somehow sustaining this thing; what the hell is it tiled with?
Despite the acidic fluids this thing is oozing, the floor is undamaged. Is it adamantium, or asbestos?
flavor: "Ugh, I think I had to clean one of these out of the sink last week." -- Dresbin

texts: Lightning Bolt it before it gets close.
Protection from Acid. And Protection from Alkali for good measure.

monsters.name: Obscure Undead Subtype
descriptions: Based off a mash-up of three different cultures' mythology, with a weakness taken from a fourth.
It's like someone threw a bunch of mythological undead in a blender and wrote stats for the result.
This homebrewed monstrosity is a mash of four other undead types from different sourcebooks.
flavor: "I've never seen one of these, but I know all the things it was cribbed off of." -- Mulcahy

monsters.name: Boarse
descriptions: Boar + Horse. Wizards will try to crossbreed anything these days.
A Boar/Horse combo? Wizards will crossbreed anything.
Half-Boar, Half-Horse, all stupid. Wizards will try to crossbreed anything.
flavor: "I hope for the sake of the local ecology this is the only one of its kind." -- Asira

texts: Blast it with a wave of fire.

monsters.name: Minmaxed Spellcaster
descriptions: He has a combination of three different classes and a huge EXP penalty, but man, look at that will save.
He has enough flaws to singlehandedly keep a psychiatrist employed, but check out his spell damage.
Cherrypicking three different classes, he'll never cast high-level spells, but his defences are fantastic.
flavor: "That is a dark road, darker than any magic. Beware, for in that way lies only madness." -- Siebel

texts: His AC and Perception are awful. Sneak up and shank him.
His Reflex save sucks. Orb of Electricity.
His Fortitude is bad. Poison Cloud.

monsters.name: Creeper Vine
descriptions: The room is covered in its tendrils, and they like to grab you when you go past.
This overgrown plant seems harmless until it tries to wrap its vines around your legs.
With vines and tendrils covering the room, anyone who thinks it's just a dumb plant will get grabbed.
flavor: "My brother once told me about a fight with a tentacle monster... but I think it was just one of these." -- Solo

monsters.name: Failed Golem
descriptions: Someone didn't follow the assembly instructions, and now there's an arm in the head socket.
The result of a failed Craft check, this golem has three legs somehow.
An untrained attempt to assemble a golem has resulted in one with its head on backwards.
flavor: "Even in the earliest days of my apprenticeship I never managed such a spectacular failure." -- Avaris

monsters.name: Newbie Necromancer
descriptions: They've been popping up everywhere since "Necromancy for Dummies" got published.
Someone held a seminar on getting started with necromancy recently, and now everyone's giving it a try.
Thanks to a local necromancer's conference, everyone with black robes and access to corpses is trying it.
flavor: "If only my sermons got this sort of result. Maybe if I provided snacks..." -- Neville

monsters.name: Dark Recruit
descriptions: The Forces of Evil have surged in membership ever since they started hosting job fairs.
A recent recruitment drive by the Forces of Evil has provided plenty of new members.
Seems that those recruiting posters for the Forces of Evil have done their job.
flavor: "People are only signing up because the Forces of Evil offer healthcare benefits." -- The Formless

monsters.name: Personal Space Invaders
descriptions: Ugly little gremlins, they like to get far, far too close to people.
These hideous little gremlins enjoy giving awkward handshakes and hugs that last too long.
Not only do these repulsive gremlins enjoy giving unpleasant handshakes, their hands are permanently clammy.
flavor: "I can't stand these things, it's almost as bad as dealing with city merchants." -- Uharo

texts: Set a trap and lure them into it.

monsters.name: Taped-up Skeleton
descriptions: You'd think there would be no shortage of intact skeletons to use for materials in this dungeon.
Are there really so few intact skeletons in this dungeon that they have to be taped together?
Some newbie necromancer here must have been desperate for materials.
flavor: "Maybe if we leave it alone long enough it'll just fall apart on its own." -- Wyatt

texts: Set off a trap when it's in the way.

monsters.name: Dwarven Robot Bees
descriptions: Who thought this was a good idea?!

texts: Sneak and pray to all the gods they don't notice.
Smoke the bees to disable their tracking.
Not the bees! Not the bees!

monsters.name: Trainee Ninja
descriptions: Someone should have told her not to wear white socks with her sandals.
They'd be better hidden if they'd taken off the bright red bandana.
Unfortunately someone slipped bleach in their laundry so their once-black robes are kind of a faded gray.
flavor: "If a ninja fails to hide, are they really a ninja?" -- Lyndra

texts: Set off the trap he's hiding next to.

equipment.name: Shortsword
descriptions: No adventuring party is complete without possessing one of these at some point.
You're not a real adventurer until you've had at least one of these in the party.
You have to have one of these in the party at some point to be a REAL adventurer.
flavor: "It slashes AND stabs. What more could dungeon crawlers like you want?" -- Uharo

equipment.name: Shortspear
descriptions: When spears are too long and daggers too short for your stabbing needs, the shortspear has your back.
Want to wield a polearm but don't want to use two hands to do it? Here's the solution!
If you want both a shield and a polearm, the shortspear is the way to go.
flavor: "What this? Some kind of toothpick?" -- Vikari

equipment.name: Shortbow
descriptions: To be fair, it might be a regular bow for small-sized creatures.
It could also be a longbow for tiny creatures.
If you've ever found yourself needing to fire a bow under a low ceiling, this is what you needed.
flavor: "Even a small arrow can bring down a giant, provided you hit something important." -- Ralford

equipment.name: Shortaxe
descriptions: All the limb-hacking power of an axe without the cumbersome swinging arc.
Whoever said axes are slow and unwieldy weapons hasn't tried one of these.
Just in case you needed to chop up some shortlogs for your shortfireplace.
flavor: "Fortunately, I don't belong to one of those orders that says knights must only use swords." -- Talrath

out_of_time_messages: You are out of time! The Omnimental has gathered enough power to escape the dungeon.
You have run out of time! A wave of power rips through the dungeon, signaling the Omnimental's escape.
The Omnimental has escaped the dungeon! You have taken too long to attempt to stop it.
cure_messages: You cure some small wounds with a little bit of divine magic.
A light curing of wounds heals some of the damage you have taken.
A few words of divine magic cure some small wounds.
mass_cure_messages: Everyone's wounds are healed with a divine invocation.
The whole party is healed a bit by a surge of divine magic.
With some words of divine power and a gesture, the party's wounds are healed.
out_of_health_messages: You are forced to fall back and retreat to heal your wounds.
The party has taken too many wounds; you are forced to retreat and heal.
The extent of your wounds forces you to retreat to a safe place and heal.
restart_messages: Suddenly the dungeon collapses.
The dungeon explodes.
The dungeon implodes.
And then everybody died.
Rocks fall; everyone dies.
You all have an aneurysm.
You all have a heart attack.
You all suffer a fatal nosebleed.
You all forget to breathe.
Your party realizes that they are merely characters in a video game, and refuse to continue.
Your party suffers a critical existence failure.
A dragon eats the party.
A dragon steps on the party.
A dragon falls on the party.
You are eaten by a grue.
A stone block falls on your head! You die...
Your party spontaneously combusts.
You have died of dysentery.
And then it turns out that it was all a dream.
And then the dungeon collapsed? Come on, uncle, tell us what REALLY happened...
Wait, no, that's not how it went. Let me start over from the beginning.
short_rest_messages: The party takes a few minutes to catch their breath and eat a few snacks.
The party pauses to take a snack break in a cleared room.
A short break rejuvenates your party and reminds them how tasteless trail rations are.
enter_dungeon_messages: Diabolical forces have opened portals to the elemental planes within an ancient dungeon. It falls to whatever adventurers are nearby to close these gates and defeat the Omnimental before it can gather enough power to escape the dungeon and devastate the world above.

Local adventurers have unearthed a plot to unleash an Omnimental upon the lands of Cordan. Before the Omnimental can escape, the Heroes must venture into the dungeon the portals are in, close them, and defeat the Omnimental.

A group of adventurers has broken through evil's legions at the entrance to a dungeon. While the rest hold the line, four of them must delve into it, close elemental portals, and defeat the Omnimental before it gathers enough power to escape and wreak havoc upon Cordan.

Some adventurers out dungeon crawling have stumbled on a scheme to unleash an Omnimental upon the lands of Cordan. For lack of anyone better in the area, these adventurers must now close the elemental portals and defeat the Omnimental, or there won't be a civilization left for them to sell their loot to.
long_rest_messages: The party stops in a safe location to tend to their wounds and make a pot of tea.
A long rest gives the party time to heal their wounds and make a quick meal.
After a long rest period, with wounds tended and bellies full, the party is ready to resume their adventure.

heroes.flavor: Hailing from the frozen north and wearing thick furs over their muscles, the berzerker excels at fighting, punching things, and breaking stuff.
heroes.name: Vikari
heroes.quote: Tiny dungeon monsters will regret not running in fear!

heroes.flavor: Sworn to the service of a noble order dedicated to keeping the peace in the realms, the knight is trained in combat prowess and polite conversation.
heroes.name: Talrath
heroes.quote: Those that stand in our way shall be swept aside.

heroes.flavor: War mages read as many books on strategy as they do books of spells, and use the voice of a drill instructor to chant their spells.
heroes.name: Laurie
heroes.quote: The proper application of arcane might can tip the scales in any battle.

heroes.flavor: Born with the gift of arcane power, those who manage not to blow themselves up in their youths become fearsome, if squishy, combatants.
heroes.name: Eleri
heroes.quote: Nothing in this dungeon can withstand the full force of my power.
